page.title: 01The Wetton and Grindon Area
page.content: On the east side of the deep and superbly beautiful Manifold Valley is Wetton - a compact stone village close to Wetton Mill and only a mile across the moors from Alstonefield. All around is beautiful country-side. A local beauty spot is Thor's Cave which is a vast cave that extends for over 100 feet back into the hillside. Wetton church was rebuilt in 1820 but it retains its 14th century tower with its unusual external stair-turret to the belfry. To the west of the Manifold Grindon sits on the edge of the moor just before the land drops away into the steeply sided valley. It has about 42 habitations, a 19th century church, a pub and a village hall. It is a close knit community and the inhabitants are very concerned about the number of holiday cottages there.
